708576f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708576f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, at W. 34th Street, showing at the
S. W. and N. W. corners respectively the Astor and Stewart homes.
The former is shortly to be removed for the second half of the
Waldorf-Astoria Hotel. The latter is the home of the Manhettan
Club at this date. At the left is a portion of the Hotel Waldorf
that was opened in 1893.
About 1898
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
South West corner 34th St. and 5th Ave.
JJ Astor Res. 34th and 5th Ave.
Cn this sii stood the Astoria Hotel
the second half of the Waldorf-Astoria,
and now the Empire State Bldg. stands here.
Photograph by Brown Brothers
220 West 42nd St.
New York City

712155f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712155f-a.text:
34th Street, at and adjoining the N.W. conner of Fifth Avenue,
including No. 3-9 West, the James McCreery \& Company store.
No. 1, in the center, was originally the Century Building. A
detail of the Waldorf-Astoria clearing, aojoining the S.W. corner,
is shown in the foreground.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708598f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708598f-a.text:
North on Fifth Avenue from B.Altman's Department Store,
34th to 35th Streets.
February 11, 1930.
P.L.Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712159f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712159f-a.text:
34th Street, north side, from Fifth to Sixth Avenues, across
the clearing on the south side at and adjoining Fifth Avenue, where
the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria has been demolished.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708587f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708587f-a.text:
Looking up Fifth Avenue from 34th Street.
hn.d.  American fress Assn.

708566f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708566f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, north across West 34th Street.
At the left margin is a portion of the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.
Opposite same is the distinctive Knickerbocker Trust Co. bldg.
This is at the N. W. corner of 34th Street and was erected on
the former A. T. Stewart home site.. The crosstown street-cars
are on 34th Street.
About 1910
Underhill, photographer
Gift of Urbrock Collection
NO REPRODICTIONS

708508f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708508f-a.text:
Wrecking old Waldorf Astoria, 34th Street at Fi th Avenue.
December 31, 1929.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO RRPRODUCTIONS.
Foundation of old Waldorf Astoria Hotel, demolished for
construction of Empire State Buildingw and view of east
side of Fifth Avenue at 34th Street.
B. Altman's Department Store at right.
February 11, 1930.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
N.  W. corner 34th Street ano Fifth Avenue, across old Waldorf-
Astoria site.
February 11, 1930.
P.L. Sperr,Photographe.

708568f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708568f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, at the N. W. corner of West 34th Street,
showing the Knickerbocker Trust Co. builiing.
About 1920
Underwood A Underwood, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection
NO REPRODICCTIONS

708579f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708579f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., at the N.W. corner of West 34th Street, showing two
identical views of the 4-story mansion of the Manhattan Club, formerly the
A.T. Stewart home. The club was organized in 1865 and its home was
considered the most commodious and most beautiful club house in the world.
About 1897.
August Loeffler.
P. L. Sperr Collection.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712153f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712153f-a.text:
3-45 West 34th Street, north side, west of Fifth Avenue, seen
across the Waldorf-Astoria clearing on the south side. No. 3-9 is
the store of James McCreery \& Company.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708580f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708580f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, at the N. W. corner of West 34th Street,
showing the A. T. Stewart mansion that later became the home
of the Manhattan Club.
About 1870s
American Studio, photo
87 Nassau St., N. Y. C.
Gift of Urbrock Collection
REPRODUCTION RIORTS UNKNOWN

708574f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708574f-a.text:
Home of Nrs. William Astor, south-west corner of
Fifth Avenue and 34th Street, 1883, just before
the old Waldorf Astoria took its place.
''Please credit to Museum of the Cty ofNew York.''

712158f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712158f-a.text:
34th Street, north side, east from 19 West, west of Fifth Avenue,
an aerial view, showing the clearing at the S.W. corner of Fifth
Avenue.
February 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712158f-b.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712158f-b.text:
34th Street, north side, east from 19 West, west of Fifth Avenue,
an aerial view, showing the clearing at the S.W. corner of Fifth
Avenue.
February 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708586f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708586f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 34th to 36th Streets,inclusive,
showing the iialdorf-astoria clearing in the left foreground.
February 11,1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708572f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708572f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue in a fashionable shopping district- looking north
from 34th Street.
JJune 1924 Kadel \& Herbert

708575f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708575f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, at the S. W. corner of West 34th Street,
showing the remaining Astor home outlined against the
Hotel Waldorf. The latter stands on the site of the
other of these twin houses. The remaining dwelling is
to go the same way, providing the site for the second
half of the combined Hotel Waldorf-Astoria. In time,
the Empire State Building will succeed these.
Betw. 1893-98
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED

708569f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708569f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., at the S.E. corner of East 34th Street. Note the Traffic
Tower on Pifth Ave.
About 1923.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712161f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712161f-a.text:
(1)
34th Street, south side, from Fifth to Seventh Avenues, showing
the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria (shortly to be demolished) at Fifth
Avenue, and the Hotel McAlpin at the S.E. corner of Sixth.
May 12, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, another view not quite including the corner of the
Walcorf-Astoria.
May 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712151f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712151f-a.text:
1, 3-9, 11 West 34th Street, adjoining and west of Fifth
Avenue. No. 3-9 is the store of James MoCreery \&. Company.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712156f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712156f-a.text:
11, 13-15, 17-19, 21-23, 25-27 West 34th Street, north side, we
of Fifth Avenue, acroas the clearing on the south side.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712154f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street - 5th Avenue
712154f-a.text:
34th Street, north side, east from and including Fifth Avenue,
aerial view across Fifth Avenue from the south side east of
Sixth Avenue. In the foreground the Waldorf-Astoria clearing
is being excavated for the construction of the Empire State
Builoing.
February 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708577f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708577f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, north from West 34th Street
(left) showing prominently the Alexander T. Stewart mansion
at the NI.W. corner. This subsecuehtly became the Hanhattan
Club and early in the twentieth century was demolished.
Originally the site was occupied by the ''Sarsaparilla''
Thompson home.
The structure indicated with an (Y) was forrerly
the Casell hcuse which later became the home of the
University Club. After being remodelled (1287) in the
Tueen Anne style it housed the prcaent New York Club.
Senarating t'iese two club structuies is the
2-story Avery Gallery. To the right margin apoears s
portion of the Brick Presbyterian Church at the N.W.
corner of 37th Street.
Circa 1900
Ewing Galloway
NO PEPROEEICTIONS
Nec w SS

712152f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712152f-a.text:
1-39 West 34th Street, at, adjoining, and west of the N.W. corner
of Fifth Avenue, seen across the clearing on the south side, which
exposes the wine cellars of the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.
February 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708509f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708509f-b.text:
(1)
Fifth Avenue, east side (buildings thereupon), at E. 34th
Street (center intersection). The photographer is viewing
northeastward across the Empire State Building site, from a
point to the west of the Avenue on W. 33rd Street. Occupyin2
the 34th-35th Street frontage is B. Altman's department store.
Across the roof of same appears the upper portion of the
Combustion Engineering Building on Madison Avenue. In the loft
background is the Lincoln Building.
P. L. Sperr  February 11, 1930
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Another view of the same intersection, taken at an earlier
date. The farther building is the B. Altman \& Co. department
store; the buildings in the foreground are at he southeast
corner of the intersectfon. This view is notable for the dis-
tinctness of the ornamentation around the Altmen building. The
columns are in the Ionic order of classical Greek architecture.
Wilberforce Eames Collection 1916
MAY BE REPRODUCED

708509f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708509f-a.text:
(1)
Fifth Avenue, east side (buildings thereupon), at E. 34th
Street (center intersection). The photographer is viewing
northeastward across the Empire State Building site, from a
point to the west of the Avenue on W. 33rd Street. Occupyin2
the 34th-35th Street frontage is B. Altman's department store.
Across the roof of same appears the upper portion of the
Combustion Engineering Building on Madison Avenue. In the loft
background is the Lincoln Building.
P. L. Sperr  February 11, 1930
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Another view of the same intersection, taken at an earlier
date. The farther building is the B. Altman \& Co. department
store; the buildings in the foreground are at he southeast
corner of the intersectfon. This view is notable for the dis-
tinctness of the ornamentation around the Altmen building. The
columns are in the Ionic order of classical Greek architecture.
Wilberforce Eames Collection 1916
MAY BE REPRODUCED

708567f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708567f-a.text:
FiTCh AvenLe, nnorun rrom oaun ourew..
Knickerbocker Trust building, with white columns, in
foreground. This was originally designed by Stanford White, but
has since been made into a tall building..
1307
Brown Brothers, Photogranhers.
NO REAOUCTIONS

712160f-a.title: Manhattan: 34th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712160f-a.text:
W. 34th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues
and viewed in a westward direction. Under renovation is the building
occupied by ''Spears'', a furniture house which adjoins the Empire State
Building (left). To the right appears the lower easterly side of the
Hotel McAlpin at Broadway.
August 1937.
0ift of Geo. D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

731274f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Police Parade.
731274f-a.text:
Celebrations - Parades - Municipal Events: A set of 3 views of an
unknown occasion : photographed on Fifth Ave. at 34th Street and showing
the columned building of B. Altman and Co. for a background. The banners
bearing the letters W.S.S. undoubtly mean War Savings Stamps and if so,
signify a period between 1917-1918. The photographer gives another date.
Views 1 and 2 are of the Police Department, while 3 is of the Fire Depart-
ment. The intersection shown is East 35th Street.
19197
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712161f-b.text:
(1)
34th Street, south side, from Fifth to Seventh Avenues, showing

708581f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 34th Street
708581f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, north from West 34th to 35th
Street's, showing the Manhattan Club (former A. T. Stewart
mansion), the Fifth Avenue Art Galleries, and the New York
Club (former Caswell home that became the University Club).
34th Street is to the left of the center, while the Avenue
is to the right.
March 17, 1894
Gift of Urbrock Collection
